alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Johnson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Johnson, north central Knott, northern Floyd, east central Breathitt and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vail, or 13 miles north of Hindman, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Waldo around 340 PM EDT. Orchard, Ordway, Gunlock, Fredville, Mid and Hippo around 345 PM EDT. Pyramid, Gapville and Hueysville around 350 PM EDT. Gypsy around 355 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dotson, Blue River, Brainard, Alphoretta, Martin, Dock, Arkansas, Allen, Bonanza, Dobson, Swamp Branch, Dwale, Beaver Junction, Allen City, Prestonsburg, Cliff, Lancer, Corn Fork Hollow, Leander, Patrick, Emma and Alvin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential downpours are also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
